questions.question: Why did colonists want to leave Britain and go to America?

choices.answer: They wanted freedom from British laws.
They were looking for new land and more space.
They were looking for new resources and trade.
All of these answers are correct.

questions.question: The 'Stamp Act' was a law passed by the British government which said that the colonists

choices.answer: must pay a tax for all important papers.
must pay tax when they buy tea.
must use postage stamps.
must pay for dumping tea into the Boston Harbour.

questions.question: The colonists didn't want to pay taxes to the British government because

choices.answer: they didn't want to buy British tea.
they were not allowed to vote.
they were poor and had no money.
there were no laws about paying taxes.
a tea party with King George III.
a way for the colonists to disguise themselves.
a protest against taxes and trade restrictions.
a sudden action by an angry mob.

questions.question: In the cartoon 'Horse America' the horse represents

choices.answer: the Sons of Liberty
the British government
the American government
King George III

questions.question: The part of the British government that makes laws is called

choices.answer: Sons of Liberty
Monarchy
Parliament
Congress

questions.question: The Declaration of Independence says that

choices.answer: the colonies are now an independent country.
the colonies will not pay taxes to the British government.
that all people are created equal and have the same rights.
A and C are correct.

questions.question: What happens every year on the 4th of July in America?

choices.answer: People eat hotdogs and hamburgers and play baseball.
People celebrate with parades and fireworks.
People celebrate the Declaration of Independence.
All of these are correct.
using different words to mean the same thing.
different ways of pronouncing words in the same language.
the clothes and music of a country.
cultural differences

questions.question: English spoken in the US sounds different from English spoken in the UK. This is because

choices.answer: The UK and the US are far away from each other.
the colonists didn't want to sound British.
new words are needed to describe new situations.
Both A and C are correct.

questions.question: If you want to change something in the world, one way is to organize a

choices.answer: Parliament
merchant
cargo
protest

questions.question: People in the US and the UK today have the right to ………..  Not everyone in the world has this.

choices.answer: join an army
drink tea
vote
pay taxes
